intro: Flickingeria pallens, commonly known as the pale flickingeria, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains in South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. It typically grows in high-altitude regions with cool, moist climates. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural study and ecological research.
